Eve intercepted a secret message encrypted with RSA, but the modulus was carelessly constructed using two Blum integers. Can you recover the plaintext from this ciphertext? 5484263158556526984120869455555790833903768387075990834557420235336869529631451552400534616848359244183029519475891987168603492345520249500397979457565512

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6673057269322785759028927533081955025532100801592787594211748356331178472133998645529153560345691674090363962280270746852528530753342261506409658089924197, e=347329048265911962549278424794109807951536238882385183391781431702898231662197425011245225357074011463032677326607538970612790058650074333984991161807269
The lower 104 bits of p are: 14605547142722767607475065369945965627


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{veuh0s48}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5484263158556526984120869455555790833903768387075990834557420235336869529631451552400534616848359244183029519475891987168603492345520249500397979457565512
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6673057269322785759028927533081955025532100801592787594211748356331178472133998645529153560345691674090363962280270746852528530753342261506409658089924197, e=347329048265911962549278424794109807951536238882385183391781431702898231662197425011245225357074011463032677326607538970612790058650074333984991161807269
The lower 104 bits of p are: 14605547142722767607475065369945965627

extra_info: p=99795801828135217806276038324604142321992658456955242096074575122447964832827, q=66867114117835214780012101970779726091485541334245778561422463913636721145311, Ï†(n)=6673057269322785759028927533081955025532100801592787594211748356331178472133831982613207589913105385950068578411857268652737329732684764467373573403946060
